article_node.title: National Guard patrolling DC's Union Station draw heckles, photo ops and little action
article_node.summary: President Trump has deployed 800 National Guard troops to Washington, D.C., citing a public safety emergency despite crime statistics showing a decline in violent crime in the city. The deployment has sparked controversy, with local leaders and residents questioning the necessity of military presence in a city where crime rates have decreased significantly. Critics argue that the move undermines local law enforcement and raises civil liberties concerns, while some residents express fear of a militarized environment.
